title: ASL 1.6 — Daily Activities ⏰
objectives: Sign core daily actions (EAT, DRINK, STUDY, WORK, GO-TO)
Describe simple routines with time-first order
Sequence events using THEN and mark completion with FINISH

sections.heading: Time-First Routines
sections.body: In ASL routines, put **TIME first**: **MORNING STUDY. AFTERNOON WORK. NIGHT HOME EAT.** Keep lines 3–5 signs.

sections.heading: Sequence with THEN
sections.body: Link actions: **MORNING WAKE-UP, THEN EAT, THEN GO-TO SCHOOL.**

sections.heading: Mark Completion
sections.body: Use **FINISH** to show a task done: **HOMEWORK FINISH. EMAIL SEND FINISH.**

sections.heading: Partner Drill
sections.body: A signs a 3-line routine (time-first). B repeats one line to confirm. Swap.

items.q: Best base order for routine lines:
Gloss your morning routine in 3 lines (time-first + THEN/FINISH as needed).

items.prompt: Which part is hardest—time-first, sequencing, or FINISH timing?

reflectionPrompt: Record 25–35s showing your daily routine with time-first lines and at least one FINISH.
summary: You described routines with time-first framing, sequenced with THEN, and marked done steps with FINISH.
